newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuania's Mazeikiu oil refinery temporarily shut.
newsitem.headline: Lithuania's Mazeikiu oil refinery temporarily shut.

text.p: Lithuania's troubled Mazeikiu Nafta oil refinery was forced to suspend operations on Monday because of supply problems, the Baltic News Service (BNS) reported.
BNS said the plant had run short of crude oil and that its Russian suppliers were diverting stocks to Western Europe where the price of crude has risen sharply in recent weeks.
A plant spokeswoman was quoted by BNS as saying the shutdown will probably last a week.
Mazeikiu, one of the largest refineries in the former Soviet Union, has been plagued by frequent stoppages stemming from supply and technical problems.
In the first half of this year the plant operated at only 25 percent of its capacity, refining 1.3 million tonnes of crude, and posted a loss of 56 million litas.
